utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: Doc, help, doc! It stopped bleeding. It stopped bleeding.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: That's because your blood's freezing as it's hitting the air. Here, apply pressure on it.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: I think my leg is frozen.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: That's the least of your problems. The blade severed your femoral artery.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: Am I gonna lose my leg?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Frostbite's not too bad but I gotta fix your artery now. This is gonna hurt.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: You're gonna put that in me?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Glue's the best way to repair your artery at this temperature. It looks okay. Here, tear off some pieces. I have to check your foot. Blood flow looks good. Your leg should be okay.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: I thought I was done.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Yeah, like I'd let anything happen to you. You're the only one who can fix the generators. One... two... three.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: Cate, Cate, are you okay? Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I... I... I need help.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: Who am I supposed to get?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Why do I even give you an office? New case. Psych department asked for you personally.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Patient's a crazy person?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You're a crazy person. Patient's a psychiatrist.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There's something wrong with coma guy's cable.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: He seems fine with it. Your patient is an adjunct faculty member here but currently... The budget committee voted to charge for cable in the patient rooms.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Slippery slope. Today we withhold porn, tomorrow it's clean bandages.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Talk to Carlson in Derm, he runs the budget committee... After you look at this.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: After you talk to Carlson, maybe I'll...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: The patient is trapped at the South Pole.
Any possibility of evacuating her?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well that wouldn't be any fun. And for the next two months, winds make it impossible to fly anything in or out.
Could be appendicitis or a gallstone.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Or a kidney stone.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That wouldn't be any fun. If it's appendicitis down there, her appendix ruptures, she dies, there's nothing we can do. If it's stones, she takes pain meds, the stone passes, there's nothing we need to do.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Could be a struvite kidney stone.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Most kidney stones are calcium and benign. Why would you suspect a struvite stone?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Cause he said kidney stones were boring.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: It's possible. She's on birth control. Lots of sex could lead to urinary tract infection, which could lead to an infection-laced struvite kidney stone.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Excessive Antarctic drilling. Bad for the environment and the ladies.
If it's a struvite stone she needs to break it up quickly before the infection shuts down her kidneys.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: This is where it gets fun. These are the supplies and medications she has available.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Nothing here that could break up a kidney stone.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: What else do they have down there?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I just said...

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I don't mean medical stuff, other stuff. Some geological equipment breaks ice and rock the same way we break kidney stones. Discovery channel. I like watching them blow stuff up.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Who doesn't? That reminds me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Coma guy needs cable. Women's billiards is the only thing that's keeping him alive.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I'm sure Carlson will be moved by HIS plight.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Carlson won't listen to me since I hit on his wife.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You knew?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: God no. I thought I was hitting on his daughter. Look, you're on the committee. He'll listen to you. I'm an avid reader of committees with hotties message boards.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Amoxicillin, 500 milligrams IV.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Studies conducted in major hospitals indicate that happy patients recover faster. Studies conducted in my apartment show that TV makes people happy. Premium channels have a particularly striking effect.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Charging patients for cable is bringing in 13 grand a month.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Until this injustice is righted, I am going to waste 13 grand a day. It's 2 dollars 49 cents down.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Get an EKG and a cardiac enzyme. If those check out, discharge him and tell him to get a snow blower.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How much is 13 grand divided by 4 cents?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I am not giving you cable. You're going to have to somehow survive with the broadcast networks alone.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'll be fine on Tuesdays.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: If sound waves from the flaw detector break the egg it should safely dissolve your kidney stone.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: This isn't going to work.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: There's no reason it shouldn't. Sound waves are sound waves. Stones are stones.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Some are bigger than others. Some are inside me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How's it going, team MacGyver? Oh, great. I can't get cable, but I can get the South Pole on hi-def.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: We're almost ready to start the test.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Test? Did Ford test the Edsel? Did Coke test New Coke? Did Shakespeare test his final play, Snow Dogs?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I'm guessing you're Dr House? I was wondering when you might drop by.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Can she see me?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Think Jagger shows up for the sound check? Okay. Roadies, off the stage. Go help Cameron in the ER.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Why? No way you're just doing her a favour.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: ER is standing room only. Which means Cameron's bound to make a mistake. Find it so I can blackmail her. As far as you know, this is way more than just some silly battle over cable.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Ready.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You, you might want to just, dial it down a smidge.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I am not doing this. Your kidney stone theory hinges on me having sex, but I...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Let me guess. You're as pure as the driven snow.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Only if the snow likes to be on top. But I am here doing psychological research, generally not a good idea to swap fluids with your subjects.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Struvite stones are possible in people who don't have sex. They're certainly possible in people who claim not to have...

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I've had no UTIs. No pain on urination.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You do realise that only one of us is a real doctor?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: You do realise that only one of us has any control over my actions?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Dr. Milton, are you able to run a chem 7?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: That'll tell us if her kidney function's declining. If it is, he's right. Struvite stone's most likely explanation. If not, she's right. Sorry, I know how you like to avoid avoiding confrontation.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: While we're waiting for that test to prove me right, start IV cefuroxime. Keep the infection in the stone from wiping out your kidneys.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I'll send the chem 7 results when I'm done.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She's a great psychiatrist. One session, I've got shrinkage.
House wants us to spy on you, report back.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: And you're telling me this because...

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: We don't want to do it.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I don't see a problem so far.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: If our choice is between pissing House off or pissing you off, that's not much of a choice.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: So unless I give House cable, you're going to make my life miserable.
Yes.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: And you're telling me this so you won't feel as guilty when you do it.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Accommodating House's every whim is not my job anymore.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: But it is ours.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: House will get what he wants.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Maybe we should just pay for it ourselves and tell him she folded.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Your chem 7 results show that your kidney function is declining. Sounds like a kidney stone to me.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: The decreased function could be from dehydration caused by vomiting due to a gallstone.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You agreed that the chem 7 would decide if it was a struvite stone.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I agreed to do the test. The results are up for interpretation. I'll redo the test in an hour when I'm re-hydrated.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Have you noticed any improvement since starting the cefuroxime?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Not really. The pain's about the same.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: While you're waiting, we should run another test with the geology equipment...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're not taking the cefuroxime. She's right handed. Means she would've put the IV in her left arm. Catheter in the arm makes it hard to bend the elbow the way people do when they drink!

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: We have a limited supply of medication and I'm not about to waste it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Last I checked, you had a limited supply of doctors.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Right before I got sick, one of my crew members severed his femoral artery. He needs the cefuroxime.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Right, he called dibs.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: His need is definitive. Mine is speculative.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're breathing fast.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: It's because I'm pissed off!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Lift up your chin. Show me your windpipe.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Ah! My chest hurts.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's deviating to the left.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Means her right lung is collapsing.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Cate Is anyone there with you?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Sean went to the mess.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You need to call someone.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There's no time. Get a syringe and a needle.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Why am I doing…

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Shut up and look.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: She could pass out. She needs...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She needs to re-inflate that lung. Okay, now pull out that plunger. I want you to stab yourself in your right side between the second and third rib in the midclavicular line. By the time we get someone else there, you'll have suffocated. Just do it. See all the good stuff that happens when you listen to me?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Means it's not a kidney stone.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Right side pain, vomiting, and now a lung that gets traumatised without any trauma. Sounds odd, probably is odd.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We should discuss this, then call her back.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No it's fine. I made sure we got the South Pole long distance plan. Your latest kidney function test shows...

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I know what it shows, I ran it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The more you interrupt, the longer my grandstanding is going to take.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Since when do you let patients participate in differentials?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Since the patient and her doctor happen to be the same person. Your kidney function is still declining, means you have a kidney problem.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: But not one that needed antibiotics. Makes us equally wrong.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, makes us both wrong. Not equally. You were at least six wronger.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: They run a PPD before you shipped out?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: On me and everybody else here, it's not TB.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Excuse us a second. Cancer explains the symptoms. A tumour in her lung or kidney that threw a clot to the other organ.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And you're worried the tumour might overhear, realise we're on to it.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Cancer's a hard diagnosis for patients even when they're not in the South Pole. We should figure this out, maybe bring Wilson in.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Obviously you two think I'm in bad shape.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Only if you count the tumour.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: House!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Probably in your abdomen. But you don't have any advanced imaging equipment. You also don't have a surgeon to biopsy it, any stains to use on the slide, or an oncologist to analyse it. We're too far away to hold her hand.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I have cancer?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Possibly.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Since the only imaging equipment you have is X-ray, let's start there. X-ray your entire body.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I'll upload the images when I'm done.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good for you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She's annoying. Refused to take the antibiotics because other people might need them.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: She said she cares about other people? What a poser. KUB is clean. You don't like her because she's a psychiatrist.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm a complicated man. I loathe her for many reasons.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Never before has a profession been so decried by someone who needed it so badly.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You talk a lot of smack about tranny hookers.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Enlarged mediastinal node.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Lymphoma.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Probably, but we can't confirm it without a biopsy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You can't analyse a biopsy without a stain.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: We can't biopsy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Cause they don't have stains down there. We need a substitute.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: She can't biopsy that node without a surgical team and an OR.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Anything with a strong colour could work as a stain. Printer ink, food colouring, coffee.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No thanks.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Find a node closer to the surface, one she can biopsy.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: That makes sense.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That makes sense?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I said it first.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: In a shockingly calm manner, after I'd just been jerking you around for 30 seconds without you complaining or analysing said jerking.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I was being mature.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: In a lavender shirt. You for some reason are happy.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: How dare you? The X-rays don't show any other abnormal nodes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Abnormal nodes can be felt before they can be seen on an X-ray. You're wearing that shirt for someone.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: The health department. They frown on topless oncology. You're going to do a physical?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Have to. You and Foreman are going to be here looking for a stain.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I can do the physical. There's no reason you need to watch.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I can think of at least three reasons. One of them's medical.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Where are you? Not in your office.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're not in the hospital. No reason for me to be.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I am not undressing for you in your apartment.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're not in my apartment. You're three quarters of a world away. I promise not to get fresh.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I'm not taking off my clothes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: One of us has to.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Show me your place.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's got walls, a floor, and in some places, a roof.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I am not exposing myself without some reciprocity.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's my apartment, it's not my soul. Living room.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Slow down. Lots of books. I'm betting all medical.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Only if you count Jenna Jameson's autobiography as a gynaecological text.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Fiction is a waste of time unless you can laugh at it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I love to laugh. Moving on.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Back up. How bad is the insomnia? Let me quantify that. Do you drink two or three scotches before passing out in front of the TV?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You are so far off. It's bourbon.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: No photos anywhere. Family and friends aren't important?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, you're sick. You have 20 people down the hall and you've had exactly one visitor.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I don't want to panic anyone.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You don't like people. You hide on that ice cube so…

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Stop projecting. You're anti-social, so you assume I'm anti-social.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How about if I just get naked and you shut up?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: If I thought I could get you naked, I would've led with that. You'd rather show me your soul than your leg.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Great. You’ve got me all figured out. You going to try and fix me now?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I never said you needed fixing.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He's letting her take part in the differentials.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Of course he is. He likes her. Big shock, spaghetti sauce doesn't work as a lymph tissue stain. I'll try... the coffee.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He's annoyed by her, doesn't respect her as a doctor, constantly insults her.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: That's House's version of courtship.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Oh, god. He's been wooing me for years.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: She's the perfect woman for him. Willing to literally go to the end of the earth for her career, making her unavailable for a real relationship. And she's afflicted with a mysterious illness.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Soya sauce is a no-go.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: We're going to be here all night.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How long does it take you to get naked?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: It's the South Pole. I wear a lot of layers. Okay. Ready.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I saw socks. That's not naked.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Have I mentioned it's freezing here? When they discover lymph nodes in feet, I will take off my socks.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Use your right hand to palpate the nodes. Any node you can feel is one we can biopsy. Let's start with your breasts, move down to the ass, then...

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I was thinking... go from the neck and work my way down.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, you could. But I'd never forgive myself if we found something before we got to your breasts.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I'm starting with the anterior cervical nodes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Turn your head. Locate the SCM muscle.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I know how to find my lymph nodes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: They teach you that before or after the class on fondling your inner child?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: No swelling, no tenderness, and I can hear that, House.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just thought it might help you relax. Anything in the axillary nodes?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: All clear. Both sides.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Slide your hand to your sternum, probe for nodes. Moving slowly downward.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Down to what, House?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sorry, can't hear you on account of your heavy breathing.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I'm supposed to be on oxygen, you tool.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hold it. Your fingers didn't go quite as deep. Feel that node again.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: It…it's swollen.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Looks like you're doing a biopsy.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: It's pretty numb.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Okay, take a deep breath... and insert the needle into the node.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Come on, Cate. Let's get this over with.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You used her name.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just trying to move things along, Bob.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Okay, I'm in.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You need to pull back on the syringe. You need to pull harder.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's a valid medical question.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I have never heard you ask a patient that question. You've never asked me that question, and you've seen me fall down a flight of stairs drunk. You've slept with her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She's 9,000 miles away. And while a certain part of me unfurled…

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No, you… Somehow you've been intimate with her. Why are you following me?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Thought you were following me.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No, you are definitely following me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Out to lunch.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You never go out to lunch. Means there's a reason you're going out to lunch. I assume that reason is a human being.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Or a sandwich.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sandwiches can come here.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: So can human beings.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yet she's not, which I find interesting.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I'm leaving now.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Small world.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Are you going to follow me into my car?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's got two doors.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Okay, look. The reason I haven't told you is…

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Call off your dogs, House. Your little helpers are interrogating my patients, swiping my charts, intercepting prescriptions.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why would you think that I'm…

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Because I'm not a moron. You had to be pulling the strings here. You think that because they make me miserable I'm going to give you cable?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Let's assume that's true. And it certainly sounds like it might be. What are you going to do?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Nothing. I resigned from the budget committee. I only joined the committee to help the hospital. You made me a liability. I now have zero influence over the hospital's cable policy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well done.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: It didn't work. There's nothing more that we can do.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Put these up.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Free Rottweiler puppies. Please call after 11:00 pm and before 5:00 am. Is this Cameron's home number?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I love a new puppy. My last one was delicious, very tender.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: There's no point in torturing her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If she can resign, she can un-resign. Go to def-con one. Forget waiting for a mistake, make her make one.
You want us to sabotage another doctor, possibly harm a patient, all so you can have cable.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Harm suggests permanent damage. Get her to screw up, then fix it. Oh, and this time, don't tell her what you're going to do before you do it.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: So, how long do I let the lymph node marinate in the red wine?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: It should be ready now. Try increasing the magnification on the camera.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: You know, I e-mailed a couple colleagues at the hospital about you.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You're checking up on me, not House?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Yeah, well House is straightforward, brilliant, and an ass.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Two out of three good qualities, clear majority.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Whereas you, on the other hand, have a perfect score. You are responsible, nice, human, and yet you're House's best friend.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Hold there. Makes you think he's secretly nicer than he seems?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Makes me think that you're secretly a lot less nice than you seem.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Do you always insult your doctors?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: It's not an insult. Indiscriminate niceness is overrated.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No wonder he likes you. Based on this slide, you do not have cancer.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Oh thank god.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I do see some inflammation which could mean…

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Ah!

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Cate? You all right?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: My left side, it hurts... It's the same pain that I had on the right.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Your other kidney.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: No, I hope it's something, It's maybe Oh, no! I'm screwed.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Bad news is you're 0 for 2 in the kidney department.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Is there good news? You're back at home.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Of course. There's cable. And the freedom to work pant-free.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: That is good news.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wilson found signs of inflammation in your biopsy. That plus the two failing kidneys points to autoimmune disease. Probably SLE or vasculitis. Treatment for both is prednisone. Start with 100 milligrams...

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Autoimmune is just your latest theory. Like cancer before that, and a kidney stone before.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Take the prednisone, you'll get better, that'll be your confirmation.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: You practice medicine like it's a fire sale. You've wasted antibiotics, X-rays.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That was not a waste. We ruled out…

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: We have a crew member here who has asthma. If he has an episode after I've used up the prednisone, he'll die.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There a good chance he's going to die anyway, since there won't be a doctor there to help him.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Show me proof that it's autoimmune and then I'll take the prednisone.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We should send her outside.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Right, just tell her to head north until she runs into a hospital.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Autoimmune diseases are basically inflammation running wild. Extreme cold has been used as treatment, like putting ice on a sprained ankle. She starts to feel better outside, we know it's autoimmune.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Is that my wallet?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah, you can have it back. I've already been through it. I like your ice on a sprain metaphor. Makes it seem like we're not killing her.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: She'd only need to be outside five minutes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Without her mittens. Mom told me that was a bad idea. Especially that winter it was 70 below and I had dual kidney failure.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: This is a good idea. It's perfect for you. Experimental, risky. Wilson's right. You care about…

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You didn't touch the cash, but you took the receipts?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: $190 restaurant tab. That's dessert, probably booze. Means you lingered. Means it's at least the third date. Means…

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: To talk to the people I pay to come up with medical ideas.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: There are no ideas. The test for autoimmune is ANA. Unless penguins poop immuno-analysers, she's not…

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Before A.N.A. testing, people had autoimmune diseases. How did they know?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Before that.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: LE Prep. But she doesn't have any controlled pore glass beads.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You don't need them.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: When you shake the test tube, the paperclip will damage some of your blood cells. If you have an autoimmune disease, your immune system will gorge itself on the damaged cells. They'll get big and fat so you can see them under a microscope. How you doing?

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: No change. So how long should I give the cells to fatten up before I check them?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Couple hours. Or you could stop being a hypocrite and take the prednisone now.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Not bending to your will makes me a hypocrite?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If your psych patients demanded lab results, you'd never make a diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: So I'm wrong. You sleep like a baby, your life is unfolding as you dreamed.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Everyone is miserable. You don't change that because people don't change.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: You want to believe that because then you're freed from any responsibility for your misery.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh shut up. I get enough of this from Wilson.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: And yet you keep hanging out with him. And from what I hear, you have spent more time with me than with any other patient.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sorry about that. Call me when you get the results.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: How's your patient?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She has an autoimmune disease. Tell the psych department she's in denial.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I had to fire Cameron.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What? What happened?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: 65-year-old man came into the ER with a hip fracture. Cameron gave him Demerol. The guy was on an MAOI, put him into a hypertensive crisis.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Is he going to live?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Taub caught the error in time. If she'd just admitted the mistake, maybe I could've just suspended her. But... she's packing up, if you want to say good-bye.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We should be hearing from the South Pole in a few minutes.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: That's it?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well there's nothing to be done. She screwed up. She's got no one to blame but herself.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I got to go talk to Cameron.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Cuddy wouldn't can her for one screw-up and if she did, she wouldn't come to me. And if she did, she wouldn't open with, "how's your patient." And if she did...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Why would she lie?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Timeless question. In this case, she conspired with your coworkers to teach me that some things are more important than cable. And I'm gonna have to teach them that they're wrong. Come on, South Pole really should be calling.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: LE Prep test was negative. It's not autoimmune.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're basing that on a test done with a paperclip. Just take the prednisone.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Either find another diagnosis or find another test.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There is one way. You can take this experimental drug called... pred-ni-sone! Your Kidneys start working...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: There is another test.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I, I think Foreman may have just broken up there. What he actually said was there is no other test.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: If you have an autoimmune disease, exposure to the cold should decrease your kidney pain.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: If I go outside, we'll have our answer? And you knew about this?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I rejected it because if you're frozen solid, it's hard to get the needles into your arms.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: How long do I need to stay out?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: At least five minutes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Eight minutes outside would kill a healthy person. And healthy people don't suck on oxygen masks. Healthy people can pee.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I'll go get Sean, have him come with me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just take the prednisone!

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Once I come inside. If it's autoimmune.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Are you all right?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh I'm sure she's just fine. Cate? Do you know if there's anyone down there who has a cell phone.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Took the station mechanic 20 minutes to respond. She'd already slipped into a coma. Started her on prednisone, but no improvement.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Means it's not autoimmune. Good thing she's in a coma, or we'd have to listen to her gloat.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: And where are we going?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: To find the useful members of my team.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You're letting them off the hook?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Happy? Because of you, I'm not going to be able to watch law and order in Korean.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Why am I here?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because I want to ask you about your girlfriend. I must know who she is or you'd have told me her name.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: She doesn't have a name. It's some sort of birth defect.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There's only about 12 people we both know. I can't remember five of their names, so we're down to... Cuddy… Your ex-wives...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Your mama. You need to run a kidney function test.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes, if only she wasn't in a coma, we could get her to run a test to find out why she's in a coma. The results would likely be paradoxical. Can't be Cuddy, 'cause you're straight. Can't be…

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We could talk the mechanic through the test.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Too complicated... Unless he's thirsty.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: Drink her urine?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: If it has a strong, concentrated taste, it means the problem's in her kidneys. Watery taste means it's her brain.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: And then you can fix it?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Let's say yeah.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: How do I get the urine out?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Take a straight catheter and insert it...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: These are your only questions? Not, is it safe? Or, is there another way? Or, are you out of your minds?

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: You wouldn't ask me if…

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wait a second. You're in love with her. That explains why you're so eager to get her naked, then have a drink. Cause most guys like to go the other way around.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: Why do you care how I feel about her?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because now, I know that I can get you to do anything to save her. Tell him how to tap the keg.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You got Cameron fired.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Cuddy wasn't supposed to find out.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No kidding! Get me cable. How tough can that be? Cost a woman her job. There's only one thing you can say to keep me from firing you.
Cameron wasn't fired.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wrong.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You know?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: We're still fired?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That should be a hint as to what you're supposed to say.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: We're sorry.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wrong.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wrong.
This is a game? First we have to screw with our co-worker and now we have to try to figure out what you want us to say? This is insane. I'm not playing.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Right. You should've said this two days ago. Do not play games with me. Number one, you're going to lose, you're just not ready. Number two, the game was to force you to stop playing games. I need you to stand up to me. Challenge me. I need you to stop worrying about getting fired. Go pay for my cable.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I didn't mean on this. Seriously, I need cable.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Milk, milk, lemonade?

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: This tastes kind of watery.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That's bad news.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Either increased intracranial pressure or something's wrong with her hypothalamus.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: How do you figure out which one it is?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We don't do anything. You're going to drill a hole in her skull. If she regains consciousness, it's increased intracranial pressure.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: And if it's the other thing?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She'll die. But if it's the hypothalamus, she's dead anyway.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: If the problem is the pressure in her brain, and I fix it, is she going to be all better?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nope, but it'll give us more time to figure out what's wrong.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: I have to get someone else. I can't do this.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You love her, right? You'd do anything to save her.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: Not this. I can't do this. If, if she dies because of something that I did, then I…

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Listen, listen. I am not going to let you hurt her. Okay? Now please... This is her only chance.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, that was easy.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: Okay, her head is stabilised and the drill bit is sterile.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Place the drill bit against the upper left part of her forehead. About an inch above the temple.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: It's not going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Bone's harder than wood, lean into it. The skull's only a quarter-inch thick. Once you're midway through, drill in shorter bursts.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If it comes out the other side, you've gone too far.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: Okay, now what? Now what?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Let the fluid drain.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: She's waking up. She's waking up.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Sean? What's going on?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: South Pole doc is out of her coma, and now we have a new symptom. Increased intracranial pressure.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Why are we out here?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That's the patient room. ICP plus kidney problems plus lung collapse equals?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: The most likely suspect is a tumour throwing off clots.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We ruled out cancer.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: But not clots. What causes blood clots?
Bacterial endocarditis.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Not without a fever.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Deep vein thrombosis plus an existing PFO.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: PFO would've been discovered in her pre-South Pole physical exam.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: What if the clots aren't clots? Atherosclerosis. Fatty plaque builds up on the arterial walls, pieces break off, block blood flow. Explains everything.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She has zero risk factors. Forget fat, think clots.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're standing up to me?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Maybe.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just to clarify. You should do that when you're right. Sorry for the confusion. How could a clot…

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Could be a different kind of fat, fat emboli.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That's a perfect fit... Except it's completely impossible! Fat emboli requires an unrepaired bone break. Between the x-ray and the exam, I've seen her entire… See, that's what I'm talking about.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Take off her socks.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: I could, I could do it.

utterance.speaker: SEAN
utterance.content: No, I got it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Your toe is broken.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Oh, my god.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Bits of bone marrow have been leaking into your blood stream. Those fat emboli have caused blockages in your kidney, lungs, and brain.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: It doesn't even hurt.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Cold numbs everything. Does a particularly great job on the extremities.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You'll need to close the break to stop the marrow from leaking.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: This one you will feel.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Will you do it?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He drilled a hole in your skull after drinking your pee. I think he's up for this.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Grab the tip of her toe with your right hand. Hold the break with the other. On the count of three, pull hard. One... two... three.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Now splint your toe. You'll be fine.

utterance.speaker: CATE
utterance.content: Thank you, House.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Don't thank me. He's the one who saved your life. He likes her.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: A bottle of the Bordeaux and some sparkling water.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, you didn't pick her up. Which means she's coming from work too. Which means you're comfortable enough to meet her.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Damn. Thought I lost you when I walked backwards through my own footprints in the snow.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I think I've got it narrowed down to three possibilities.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Better leave, if you see her, it'll be cheating.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's not one of your ex-wives.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Because they hate me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: They don't. They should, but they don't. I called them. Someone new, but someone I know.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Did you ever consider being happy for me?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Briefly. You ordering the wine before she got here…

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Girls are good, House. And you know it. You solved your case because you cared about that girl.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're demonstrating the illusion of manly confidence. Which means you haven't closed the deal yet.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I closed the deal. I just like her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Still?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You knew your patient hated having cold feet because you did a physical exam, because you liked her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Your theory is I cared, therefore I let her keep her socks on? If that's what love is, then I don't want to have anything to do with it.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: It starts with warm feet but leads to other things. Your mom and I will explain when you're older.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If I'd made her take them off like I should've, I would've seen the toe and would've solved the case days ago.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: But you don't care about her.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Of course not. House doesn't care about anyone.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Sorry I'm late.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Cut throat bitch?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I call her Amber. Was she on your list?
